intro: Burnatia, commonly known as the burnet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy, often blue or purple flowers and their succulent, sometimes aromatic leaves. Burnatia species are typically found in temperate regions and are adapted to well-drained soils.
